instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
Hi.

Got this board yesterday.
When I press powerbutton the fan spins for 5 sec then it dies.
For some strange reason I decided to keep holding down the powerbutton longer and after 10 sec I heard noice from the dvd drive and after that a normal DONG.
It booted normal and everything seems to work.

I have tried another keyboard with same results.

What is causing this problem?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message: What is PPBUS voltage? Does it charge?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.63v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

they are all stable and doesn't change.
Battery is charging.

Board Looks nice

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message: Try and run ASD to check for errors

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
Ok

Current (IPOR) --Battery-BMON Eng (test 1) - Sensor Reads Within Operating Range
- Check to ensure that sensor reads within operating range.
ERROR - Sensor is reading above the high limit.
- TEST FAILED -

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message: Check sense resistors and traces again, this is a current sense issue in <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR>/51/52 circuit. Corroded trace or resistor, measure resistance between pins 17 and 18.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
yes
<RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> looks a bit strange. the solder is dark  grey

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
replaced <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> and ran a jumper from <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> and now the error error in ASD is gone and everything seems to work.

Thanks alot for your help

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message:
New problem.
Everything worked perfect except the dvd-drive. turned it off and mounted another drive. now it wont start.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is dropping from 12.6 to about 3.3 v and then back to 12.6.
no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
Bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message: Does it work from a charged battery? Probably more corrosion on sense circuits.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange power on
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable with battery but it still won't turn on
